page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: Burnewhall and Tower Farms support their own beasts off their own ground. The Burnewhall herd lies out all winter in a five acre field which is re_seeded with rye_grass each spring.They are fed on silage and kale and there is a sheltered yard with an easy_feed system. "Obviously we'd get a higher yield if they were housed,"Phil says:"But I'm satisfied with the results".His records prove it.Last year Burnewhall produced 6,874 litres with 3.99% butter fat,an excellent return.Phil used to export his surplus heifers to France but since quotas, he's sold them on the home market.He has 40 to sell this year and not surprisingly they're toppers every one.
